item.title: Chess and Incompleteness
item.description: Chess and Logic # Chess and Logic, huh? There’s something fundamental linking them, and I’m not talking about using logic to beat a game of chess. The rules of chess are similar to the axioms of a logical system. This got me thinking, can we demonstrate Kurt GÃ¶del’s incompleteness theorem in chess? If you’re not familiar (and it’s a large and difficult territory should you decide to venture there), the incompleteness theorem says that “logic systems can describe true statements that can not be derived using that system”.
